descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course covers the basic concepts of using statistical models to draw conclusions from experimental and survey data. Topics to be covered include simple linear regression, multiple regression, analysis of variance, and analysis of covariance. The emphasis will be on the practical application of the methodology and the interpretation of the results. Examples will be drawn from a wide range of fields.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: The prerequisites for this course are Math 220-0, Stat 202-0, Stat 210-0, or the equivalent.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be based on homework assignments and a final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Introduction to the Practice of Statistics, by David S. Moore, George P. McCabe

The Moore and McCabe book is currently in the eighth edition and will be for sale at Beck's Book Store on Clark street in Evanston. For the course students can purchase any edition after (and including) the third edition. Here is the link

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value:
Note-

Computation: The methods that we will discuss are computationally intensive and require specialized software. We will use SPSS, which is widely available on campus.
